ground_truth: The pimp joins the captain and Fantine's hands as the head whore officiates like a twisted wedding ceremony. Fantine puts on a show of courage as she leads the captain into the ship's hulk, which is a brothel. Fantine, pale and frail, her bodice loosened, leads the captain down to the damp dregs of the ship. We see the rotting straw mattress within as they enter, then Fantine lays down. CLOSE ON a man's hand leaving money. MOVE TO FIND Fantine lying alone on the mattress. She pulls herself into a sitting position against the head of the mattress. She has seen and recognised Valjean, some way off. He's out in the harbour district. He is talking to a beggar. Before he moves on, he hands over some money. She moves past the anchored ships, beneath the bowsprits, trying pathetically to attract custom. Fantine is out on the snow and ice-covered quayside, shivering, waiting for trade. She looks pale and sickly, but still attempts an alluring smile. As Fantine watches Valjean on his mission of mercy, a well-dressed young man, Bamatabois, comes up to her. He arrives with two friends and a valet. Javert is quietly coldly furious. He shows the blood. Fantine is almost fainting with fear, still racked with occasional spasms of coughing. Valjean steps out of the shadows. Javert turns to Fantine. Javert's assistants pick Fantine up. Javert indicates to the two policemen to drag Fantine away. To Fantine, it's as if he's come to her in a dream. Javert looks on, containing his anger, as Valjean reaches out a hand to Fantine. He holds Fantine's hands, looking into her face. Valjean picks Fantine up in his arms. As Valjean and Fantine move away, Javert stares after them, then turns and quietly instructs his assistant to follow after them. As Javert walks up the steps to his police station, his assistant stops him with an urgent letter. Javert seizes it, opens it, and reads. As he reads, his expression changes. Appalled, he realizes he's made a terrible mistake. Valjean is at his desk in his office, going through his papers once everyone else has gone when Javert enters and stands before him. Valjean conceals his shock. He looks up. Valjean is sitting staring at the Bishop's candlesticks. Valjean is furiously packing stuff up. The driver is Valjean, hesitating. Close on two horses panting. Valjean pushes through the crowds at the back of the courtroom. Before the judge has a chance to speak, the doors open and Valjean bursts in. The man accused of being Jean Valjean, a wretched down-and-out, stands before the judge. He looks uncannily like the real Valjean. Sensation in the court.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: In an atmosphere charged with tension, the pimp steps forward to join the captain and Fantine's hands together, performing this action with the solemnity of a twisted wedding ceremony, officiated by the head whore. Meanwhile, Fantine attempts to muster a show of courage as she confidently leads the captain onward into the ship's hulk, a vessel that has been transformed into a dismal brothel. Fantine, appearing pale and frail with her bodice loosely adjusted, guides the captain down to the ship's bowels, where the air is damp and heavy with decay. Upon entering, the sight of a rotting straw mattress is revealed. Fantine lies down upon it. Our focus CLOSES ON a man's hand, which leaves money behind as payment. The scene then MOVES TO REVEAL Fantine lying alone on the threadbare mattress. With effort, she pulls herself into a sitting position against the head of the mattress, her eyes scanning the surroundings. Somewhere in the distance, she catches sight of Valjean, recognizing him as he navigates the bustling harbour district. He engages in conversation with a beggar and, showing compassion, hands over some money before moving on. Fantine, in her dismal state, moves past the anchored ships, beneath their looming bowsprits, making a feeble attempt to attract business. Out on the quayside, covered in snow and ice, she shivers, awaiting trade. Her face is pallid and sickly, yet she still forces an attempt at an alluring smile. As she observes Valjean during his acts of kindness, a well-dressed young man named Bamatabois approaches her with two companions and a valet in tow. Meanwhile, Javert is nearby, quietly but intensely furious, and he presents evidence of blood. Fantine, nearly fainting with fear and continuously wracked by spasms of coughing, finds herself in distress. Stepping out from the shadows, Valjean appears. Javert then turns his attention to Fantine, and with quiet fury, motions for his assistants to pick Fantine up, instructing two policemen to drag her away. To Fantine, the scene unfolds as though she is trapped in a surreal dream. Javert observes, his anger barely contained, as Valjean reaches out, taking Fantine's hands while gazing earnestly into her face. In a gentle motion, Valjean lifts Fantine into his arms. As they move away together, Javert watches them intently before turning and discretely instructing his assistant to follow them. As Javert ascends the steps to his police station, he is intercepted by his assistant, who urgently hands him a letter. Javert seizes it, hurriedly tearing it open to read. As he absorbs the contents, his expression shifts to one of appalled realization, comprehending that he has made a monumental mistake. Elsewhere, Valjean is found at his desk in his office, sifting through his papers in solitude after everyone else has left, when Javert enters and stands before him. Valjean manages to conceal his initial shock and glances up. He sits, staring intensely at the Bishop's candlesticks, his mind working furiously as he packs his belongings. Meanwhile, the driver, identified as Valjean himself, hesitates momentarily. The frame closes in on two horses, their breaths visible as they pant heavily. Pushing through the gathering crowds at the back of the courtroom, before the judge can speak, Valjean bursts through the doors. The man accused of being Jean Valjean, a pitiable down-and-out, stands before the judge, bearing an uncanny resemblance to the true Valjean. The courtroom is swept with sensation, the charged atmosphere thick with anticipation.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: In a setting laden with a palpable sense of tension and unease, the pimp steps forward with dramatic flair, joining the captain and Fantine's hands in a symbolic gesture. This act is performed with the gravity and twisted solemnity reminiscent of a grim wedding ceremony, officiated, in a manner of speaking, by the head whore. At the same time, Fantine tries to summon a display of bravery, albeit with visible effort, as she confidently yet with underlying trepidation leads the captain into the ship's hulk. This vessel has now been repurposed into a grim and dismal brothel. Fantine, appearing pale, frail, and somewhat ghost-like, her bodice barely staying in place, guides the captain down into the ship's bowels. Here, the atmosphere is oppressively damp and permeated with the heavy scent of decay. Upon their entrance, they are greeted by the sight of a straw mattress in a state of rot. Fantine reclines upon this meager bedding. Our focus zeroes in on a man's hand, which lingers momentarily as it leaves money behind—a silent transaction. The scene then transitions, revealing Fantine lying in solitude on the threadbare mattress. With visible effort and determination, she pulls herself into a sitting position against the mattress's headboard, her gaze meticulously scanning the room around her. In the distance, she perceives Valjean with increasing clarity. She recognizes him as he navigates through the teeming harbour district, where he converses with a destitute beggar. Displaying genuine compassion, Valjean offers the beggar some money and then continues on his way. In her bleak and sorrowful state, Fantine moves through the bustling docks, beneath the towering bowsprits of anchored ships, making a feeble, almost desperate attempt to attract business. Out on the quayside, now covered in a chilling layer of snow and ice, she shivers, hoping for trade. Her face is pallid and sickly, yet she forces herself to attempt an alluring smile. As she watches Valjean engage in his acts of kindness, a well-dressed young man named Bamatabois approaches her, accompanied by two companions and a valet in his entourage. Nearby, Javert is present, exuding an air of silent but intense anger, as he presents damning evidence of blood. Fantine, teetering on the brink of fainting with fear and beset by relentless spasms of coughing, finds herself engulfed in distress. Emerging from the enveloping shadows, Valjean appears. Javert then shifts his attention to Fantine, and with a quiet but furious demeanor, he orders his assistants to seize Fantine, instructing two policemen to drag her away. To Fantine, the scene unfolds with surreal, dreamlike qualities. Javert, barely containing his rage, watches as Valjean reaches out to her, taking hold of her hands and gazing intensely at her face. In a tender and protective motion, Valjean lifts Fantine into his arms. As they move together away from the scene, Javert watches with intense scrutiny before turning away and discreetly instructing his assistant to follow them. Ascending the steps leading to his police station, Javert is abruptly stopped by his assistant, who urgently hands him a letter. He snatches it, tearing it open with haste to read its contents. As he comprehends the letter's contents, his expression transforms to one of appalled realization, finally understanding that he has committed a grave and monumental error. In another location, Valjean is discovered at his desk, sitting quietly in his office. Alone in solitude after everyone else has departed, he sifts through a variety of papers when Javert makes his unexpected entrance and stands before him. Valjean manages to conceal his initial shock, glancing up with an air of composed curiosity. He sits there, staring with intense focus at the Bishop's candlesticks, his thoughts racing as he begins to pack his belongings. Meanwhile, the driver, who is none other than Valjean himself, hesitates momentarily amid the bustling chaos. The frame zooms in on two horses, their breaths forming visible clouds as they pant heavily in the cold air. Pushing with determination through the gathered crowds at the back of the courtroom, before the judge can utter a word, Valjean bursts through the doors. The man standing accused of being Jean Valjean, a pitiable figure reduced to a down-and-out state, stands before the judge, bearing an uncanny and remarkable resemblance to the real Valjean. The courtroom is electrified with sensation, the atmosphere thick with charged anticipation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the scene unfolds, the pimp joins the captain and Fantine's hands, intertwining their fingers in a symbolic gesture, as the head whore presides over them in what resembles a twisted and dark version of a wedding ceremony, her presence casting an ominous shadow over the affair. Summoning all her strength, Fantine musters a show of courage, her resolve firm as she leads the captain away from the prying eyes, guiding him gently yet purposefully into the ship's hulk, which operates as a brothel. Despite her pale complexion and frail demeanor, Fantine, with her bodice loosened and her spirit burdened, descends into the depths of the ship, navigating her way down to the damp, decrepit remains that lie below. Upon their entrance, the rotting straw mattress is visible, a pitiful sight that awaits them. Fantine then lowers herself onto the mattress, resigning to her fate. A moment later, a man's hand comes into view, leaving money behind as a transactional token of the encounter. The scene shifts to reveal Fantine, now alone on the mattress, as she slowly pulls herself into an upright position, leaning back against the head of the mattress. Her eyes, weary yet observant, catch sight of Valjean from a distance. Valjean is located somewhere out in the harbor district, where he engages in a brief conversation with a beggar, exhibiting his kindness and generosity by handing over some money before he continues on his way. Fantine, driven by desperation, moves amongst the anchored ships, passing beneath the bowsprits, her attempts to attract custom marked by a sense of pathetic futility. Out on the snow and ice-covered quayside, she stands shivering, her body trembling in the cold as she waits for trade, her sickly pallor contrasted by the attempt at an alluring smile that she forces upon her lips. Meanwhile, she watches Valjean on his altruistic mission, her focus momentarily interrupted by the approach of a well-dressed young man, Bamatabois, who arrives in her presence accompanied by two friends and a valet, their appearance unsettling and unwelcome. Javert, observing the scene, is quietly yet palpably furious, his demeanor icy as he displays the blood. In a state of near-fainting fear, Fantine trembles, her fragile body racked by occasional, uncontrollable spasms of coughing. Emerging from the shadows, Valjean steps forward, prompting Javert to turn his attention to Fantine. Javert's assistants move in, lifting Fantine from the ground, and at Javert's indication, the two policemen proceed to drag her away. To Fantine, the unfolding events seem surreal, as if she is experiencing them in a dreamlike state. As Javert contains his seething anger, he watches Valjean extend a compassionate hand toward Fantine. Valjean takes hold of Fantine's hands, locking gazes with her, before gently lifting her into his arms. Together, Valjean and Fantine begin to move away, while Javert stands rooted to the spot, his eyes following them with unwavering intensity. He then quietly instructs his assistant to trail them, ensuring they remain within his grasp. As Javert ascends the steps to his police station, his assistant intercepts him with an urgent letter, thrusting it into his hands. Seizing the letter, Javert tears it open and reads its contents, his expression shifting dramatically as the realization of a grievous error dawns upon him, leaving him appalled. In a contrasting setting, Valjean sits at his desk within his office, sifting through his papers with focused intent now that everyone else has departed. His solitude is interrupted by Javert's entrance, as the inspector comes to stand before him. Valjean, initially shocked, swiftly composes himself, looking up to address the situation. Seated, he casts his gaze upon the Bishop's candlesticks, their presence a reminder of past transgressions and redemption. In a flurry of frantic motion, Valjean begins to pack his belongings with furious haste. Outside, a driver hesitates, identified as Valjean, while close by, two horses can be seen panting, their labored breath evidence of the urgency at hand. Valjean, driven by a pressing need, pushes his way through the throngs at the back of the courtroom. He bursts in with such force that the judge, shocked by the sudden disruption, is momentarily silenced. At the forefront of the scene stands the accused, a wretched down-and-out mistaken for Jean Valjean, bearing an uncanny resemblance to the real Valjean, creating a stir of sensation throughout the court as the crowd grapples with the unfolding drama.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The pimp officiates a twisted ceremony, joining the captain and Fantine's hands before she bravely leads the captain into the brothel, a ship's hulk. Inside, Fantine, pale and frail, guides him to a rotting straw mattress, where she lies down. Afterward, a man leaves money, and Fantine sits against the mattress's head, recognizing Valjean in the harbor district as he converses with a beggar and gives him money. Fantine, shivering on the icy quayside, attempts to attract customers despite her sickly appearance. She watches Valjean's mission of mercy until approached by Bamatabois and his companions. Javert, furious, shows blood evidence as Fantine, frightened and coughing, nearly faints. Valjean emerges from the shadows, takes Fantine's hands, and lifts her into his arms, leaving Javert to instruct his assistant to follow them. Javert receives an urgent letter while ascending his police station steps, and his expression shifts to one of regret as he reads of his mistake. Meanwhile, Valjean is alone in his office when Javert arrives. Valjean, hiding his shock, fixes his gaze on the Bishop's candlesticks before furiously packing. Hesitant, he drives through the crowds at a courtroom's back, bursting in before the judge can speak. The accused man, resembling Valjean, stands before the judge, creating a sensation in the court.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The pimp joins the captain and Fantine's hands as the head whore officiates like a twisted wedding ceremony, reminiscent of the dark underworld often hidden in cities. Fantine puts on a show of courage as she leads the captain into the ship's hulk, which is a brothel known for its notorious clientele of sailors. Fantine, pale and frail from weeks of malnutrition, her bodice loosened, leads the captain down to the damp dregs of the ship. We see the rotting straw mattress, reminiscent of the dire conditions many faced in industrial France, within as they enter; then Fantine lays down. Close on a man's hand leaving money, a transaction driven by desperation rather than desire. Move to find Fantine lying alone on the mattress. She pulls herself into a sitting position against the head of the mattress, clutching onto what little dignity she has left. She has seen and recognized Valjean, some way off, the man once known as Prisoner 24601. He's out in the harbor district, a place bustling with trade and tales from across the seas. He is talking to a beggar, extending his lifelong commitment to helping those in need. Before he moves on, he hands over some money, a gesture of kindness that runs counter to the harshness surrounding them. She moves past the anchored ships, beneath the bowsprits that jut out like the skeletons of leviathans, trying pathetically to attract custom. Fantine is out on the snow and ice-covered quayside, a harsh testament to the Parisian winter, shivering, waiting for trade. She looks pale and sickly, a shadow of her former self, but still attempts an alluring smile. As Fantine watches Valjean on his mission of mercy, a well-dressed young man, Bamatabois, known for his cruel pranks, comes up to her. He arrives with two friends and a valet, flaunting his wealth and privilege. Javert, the rigid and relentless inspector, is quietly coldly furious. He shows the blood, a sign of the brutal realities of law enforcement of the time. Fantine is almost fainting with fear, still racked with occasional spasms of coughing, a result of the untreated illness that has plagued her. Valjean steps out of the shadows, his presence a beacon of hope. Javert turns to Fantine, who can hardly comprehend what is happening. Javert's assistants pick Fantine up. Javert indicates to the two policemen to drag Fantine away, enforcing the strict justice of the day without mercy. To Fantine, it's as if he's come to her in a dream, unreal and hazy in her weakened state. Javert looks on, containing his anger, as Valjean reaches out a hand to Fantine, the woman he feels a duty to protect. He holds Fantine's hands, looking into her face with compassion. Valjean picks Fantine up in his arms, determined to help her. As Valjean and Fantine move away, Javert stares after them, then turns and quietly instructs his assistant to follow after them, his duty to the law unyielding. As Javert walks up the steps to his police station, a bastion of authority, his assistant stops him with an urgent letter. Javert seizes it, opens it, and reads. As he reads, his expression changes. Appalled, he realizes he's made a terrible mistake, a rare crack in his unfaltering pursuit of justice. Valjean is at his desk in his office, going through his papers once everyone else has gone, maintaining the façade of respectability he has built as a factory owner, when Javert enters and stands before him. Valjean conceals his shock, aware that his past as a convict might be catching up with him. He looks up, reminded of his promise to the Bishop, whose candlesticks, once given as a symbol of redemption, sit on his desk. Valjean is furiously packing stuff up, a manifestation of his instinct for survival. The driver is Valjean, hesitating as he tries to decide his next move. Close on two horses panting, their breath visible in the cold air, as they prepare for the journey ahead. Valjean pushes through the crowds at the back of the courtroom, the place where justice is all too often harsh and unforgiving. Before the judge has a chance to speak, the doors open, and Valjean bursts in, driven by a sense of justice he has come to define for himself. The man accused of being Jean Valjean, a wretched down-and-out, stands before the judge, symbolizing the miscarriages of justice that are rampant in this society. He looks uncannily like the real Valjean, adding to the courtroom drama. Sensation in the court as the truth begins to unfold.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Javert indicates to the two policemen to drag Fantine away. To Fantine it is as if he is come to her in a dream. Javert looks on containing his anger. as Valjean reaches out a hand to Fantine. He holds Fantine's hands looking into her face. Valjean picks Fantine up in his arms. As Valjean and Fantine move away Javert stares after them then turns and quietly instructs his assistant to follow after them. As Javert walks up the steps to his police station his assistant stops him with an urgent letter. Javert seizes it opens it and reads. As he reads his expression changes. Appalled he realizes he is made a terrible mistake. Valjean is at his desk in his office going through his papers once everyone else has gone. when Javert enters and stands before him Valjean conceals his shock. He looks up. Valjean is sitting staring at the Bishop's candlesticks. Valjean is furiously packing stuff up. The driver is Valjean hesitating. Close on two horses panting. Valjean pushes through the crowds at the back of the courtroom. Before the judge has a chance to speak the doors open and Valjean bursts in. The man accused of being Jean. Valjean a wretched downandout stands before the judge. He looks uncannily like the real Valjean. Sensation in the court.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The pimp joins the captain and Fantine's hands as the head whore officiates like a twisted wedding ceremony. Fantine puts on a show of courage as she leads the captain into the ship's hulk which is a brothel. Fantine pale and frail her bodice loosened leads the captain down to the damp dregs of the ship. We see the rotting straw mattress within as they enter. then Fantine lays down CLOSE ON a man's hand leaving money. MOVE TO FIND. Fantine lying alone on the mattress. She pulls herself into a sitting position against the head of the mattress. She has seen and recognised Valjean some way off. He is out in the harbour district. He is talking to a beggar. Before he moves on he hands over some money. She moves past the anchored ships beneath the bowsprits trying pathetically to attract custom. Fantine is out on the snow and icecovered quayside shivering waiting for trade. She looks pale and sickly but still attempts an alluring smile. As Fantine watches Valjean on his mission of mercy a welldressed young man Bamatabois comes up to her. He arrives with two friends and a valet. Javert is quietly coldly furious. He shows the blood. Fantine is almost fainting with fear still racked with occasional spasms of coughing. Valjean steps out of the shadows. Javert turns to Fantine. Javert's assistants pick Fantine up. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The gardener joins the pilot and Felicity's umbrellas as the chief librarian orchestrates like a bizarre birthday celebration. Felicity displays an air of cheerfulness as she guides the pilot into the elephant's trunk, which is a library. Felicity, bright and energetic, her bonnet fastened, guides the pilot down to the dry depths of the trunk. We glimpse the crumbling feather blanket within as they proceed inside, then Felicity settles down. CLOSE ON a woman's glove departing marbles. MOVE TO FIND Felicity reclining solo on the blanket. She hoists herself into an upright stance against the head of the blanket. She has spotted and recognized Victor, a distance away. He's out in the orchard square. He is chatting with a musician. Before he departs, he delivers some ribbons. She moves past the moored bicycles, beneath the streetlamps, trying cheerfully to gain attention. Felicity is out on the sand and pebble-lined beach, trembling, awaiting customers. She appears bright and healthy, yet still attempts a comfortable grin. As Felicity observes Victor on his voyage of kindness, a casually-dressed old woman, Beatrice, approaches her. She arrives with two nieces and a chauffeur. Johnson is silently coolly irate. He displays the water. Felicity is nearly swooning with excitement, still overcome with periodic fits of laughter. Victor emerges from the shadows. Johnson turns to Felicity. Johnson's comrades lift Felicity up. Johnson gestures to the two drummers to carry Felicity away. To Felicity, it's as if he's come to her in a vision. Johnson watches quietly, containing his excitement, as Victor extends a hand to Felicity. He clutches Felicity's umbrellas, gazing into her eyes. Victor lifts Felicity in his legs. As Victor and Felicity proceed away, Johnson gazes after them, then turns and quietly directs his comrade to trail behind them. As Johnson climbs the ladder to his fire station, his comrade halts him with an urgent package. Johnson snatches it, unwraps it, and examines. As he examines, his expression alters. Stunned, he realizes he's made a marvelous blunder. Victor is at his piano in his workshop, sorting through his letters once everyone else has left when Johnson enters and stands before him. Victor conceals his relief. He glances up. Victor is seated contemplating the Queen's shoes. Victor is vigorously unpacking things up. The sailor is Victor, pausing. Close on two camels snorting. Victor pushes through the throngs at the back of the theater. Before the actor has an opportunity to murmur, the curtains open and Victor storms in. The woman accused of being Janet Dixon, a jubilant wanderer, stands before the actor. She looks strikingly similar to the genuine Victor. Astonishment in the hall.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: In a grim scene, the pimp officiates a twisted ceremony as Fantine, weak and frail, leads a captain into a brothel within a ship's hulk. She lies on a rotting mattress after the transaction, noticing Valjean in the distant harbor giving money to a beggar. Later, pale and shivering on the quayside, she tries to attract customers. Bamatabois, with friends, approaches her, and soon Javert, silently furious, witnesses her arrest. Valjean steps from the shadows, offering a dreamlike salvation by holding and lifting Fantine as Javert's men take her away. Javert, receiving an urgent letter, realizes a grave error. At his desk, Valjean is interrupted by Javert, conceals his shock, then rushes to a courtroom. There, he interrupts the trial of a lookalike accused of being Jean Valjean, causing a sensation in the court.
